abstract: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection spans the years 1940-2000. The extensive collection is comprised of photographs and slides of primarily public bus and train transportation, chiefly in the Chicago, Illinois area.
creator: Sullivan, Ronald J.
description: 3/4 view of CTA streetcar 9167 parked with other streetcars at North Avenue and Cicero Avenue in Chicago, Illinois.
project: {'cycle': '2018', 'desc': 'The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection spans the years 1940-2000. The collection is comprised of photographs and slides of primarily public bus and train transportation.', 'manager': 'Jen Young', 'name': 'Ronald J Sullivan Chicago Transportation Collection', 'proposer': 'Roberto Sarmiento', 'task_number': 'P0130'}
rights_statement: In Copyright - Rights-holder(s) Unlocatable or Unidentifiable
scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.
series: Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection -- Slides, 1940-2000 – Buses, 1940-2000
subject: Chicago|Chicago Transit Authority|Transportation|Local transit|Cable cars (Streetcars)
terms_of_use: The images on this web site, from material in the collections of the Transportation Library of Northwestern University Libraries, are provided for use by its students, faculty and staff, and by other researchers visiting this site, for research consultation and scholarly purposes only. creator: Sullivan, Ronald J.
description: 3/4 view of car 2254 and other "L" train cars parked at the 54th Avenue Yards in Cicero, Illinois. Car 2254 was servicing the O'Hare-Douglas Branch, also called the Cermak (Douglas) Branch on what would become the Blue Line. Blue Line service on the Douglas Branch was discontinued in April 2008 and replaced by the Pink Line.

scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.
series: Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection -- Slides, 1940-2000 -- Charter Coach/Shuttle, 1984-2000 -- Chicago, IL, 1984-1997
subject: Chicago|Buses|Transportation

scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.
series: Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection -- Photographs, 1946-2000 – Rail, 1948-1998
subject: Skokie|Local transit|Chicago Transit Authority|Transportation|Railroads, Elevated

Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.
series: Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection -- Slides, 1940-2000 – Buses, 1940-2000
subject: Toronto|Toronto Transit Commission|Cable cars (Streetcars)|Local transit|Transportation

description: Front view of Amtrak train X2000 at Union Station in Chicago, Illinois. X2000, also called X2, is a tilting train operated by SJ in Sweden. An X2000 train set toured the United States in 1992/1993 on lease to Amtrak. The train was tested by Amtrak from October 1992 until January 1993. From May until July it was taken on a National Tour around the 48 continental states for demonstration stops at stations.

scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.

scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.

description: 3/4 view of double-decker bus in Ireland. The marquee on the bus indicates that it is servicing route 13 and "Beechwood Avenue." Córas Iompair Éireann, or CIÉ, is responsible for most public transport in Ireland.
project: {'cycle': '2018', 'desc': 'The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection spans the years 1940-2000. The collection is comprised of photographs and slides of primarily public bus and train transportation.', 'manager': 'Jen Young', 'name': 'Ronald J Sullivan Chicago Transportation Collection', 'proposer': 'Roberto Sarmiento', 'task_number': 'P0130'}
rights_statement: In Copyright - Rights-holder(s) Unlocatable or Unidentifiable
scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.
series: Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection -- Photographs, 1946-2000 – Buses, 1946-2000
subject: Ireland|Córas Iompair Éireann|Buses|Local transit|Transportation
terms_of_use: The images on this web site, from material in the collections of the Transportation Library of Northwestern University Libraries, are provided for use by its students, faculty and staff, and by other researchers visiting this site, for research consultation and scholarly purposes only. Further distribution and/or any commercial use of the images from this site is not permitted.
title: CIE/Rt. 13, Ireland

scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.
series: Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection -- Slides, 1940-2000 -- Rail, 1942-2000 --  "Ls", 1942-1997
subject: Chicago|Chicago Transit Authority|Railroads, Elevated|Transportation|Local transit

scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.
series: Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection -- Photographs, 1946-2000 – Buses, 1946-2000
subject: Chicago|Chicago Transit Authority|Transportation|Buses|Local transit

abstract: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection spans the years 1940-2000. The extensive collection is comprised of photographs and slides of primarily public bus and train transportation, chiefly in the Chicago, Illinois area.
creator: Sullivan, Ronald J.
description: 3/4 view of car 2606 at the front of a 4-car "L" train at the Randolph/Wabash station in Chicago, Illinois. Randolph/Wabash was a elevated 'L' station in the Chicago Loop. Located at Randolph Street and Wabash Avenue, it served trains running on the CTA's Brown and Green Lines on the outer loop track, and the Green, Orange, Pink, and Purple Lines on the inner loop track. Randolph/Wabash was the closest 'L' station to Metra's Millennium Station until it closed on September 3, 2017. The station was later demolished. This train was servicing the Englewood-Lake route.

scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.
series: Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection -- Photographs, 1946-2000 – Rail, 1948-1998
subject: Chicago|Subway stations|Local transit|Chicago Transit Authority|Transportation|Railroads, Elevated

description: 3/4 view of bus 3548, route 58 (25-Laramie) at 25th Street and Laramie Avenue in Cicero, Illinois.
project: {'cycle': '2018', 'desc': 'The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection spans the years 1940-2000. The collection is comprised of photographs and slides of primarily public bus and train transportation.', 'manager': 'Jen Young', 'name': 'Ronald J Sullivan Chicago Transportation Collection', 'proposer': 'Roberto Sarmiento', 'task_number': 'P0130'}
rights_statement: In Copyright - Rights-holder(s) Unlocatable or Unidentifiable
scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.
series: Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection -- Slides, 1940-2000 – Buses, 1940-2000
subject: Cicero|Buses|Local transit|Transportation
terms_of_use: The images on this web site, from material in the collections of the Transportation Library of Northwestern University Libraries, are provided for use by its students, faculty and staff, and by other researchers visiting this site, for research consultation and scholarly purposes only. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.
series: Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection -- Slides, 1940-2000 – Buses, 1940-2000
subject: Chicago|Chicago Transit Authority|Transportation|Buses|Local transit
terms_of_use: The images on this web site, from material in the collections of the Transportation Library of Northwestern University Libraries, are provided for use by its students, faculty and staff, and by other researchers visiting this site, for research consultation and scholarly purposes only. Further distribution and/or any commercial use of the images from this site is not permitted.

abstract: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection spans the years 1940-2000. The extensive collection is comprised of photographs and slides of primarily public bus and train transportation, chiefly in the Chicago, Illinois area.
creator: Sullivan, Ronald J.
description: 3/4 view of CTA's "Getting Along: Peace Bus" at the former Comiskey Park at 35th and Wentworth in Chicago, Illinois. The Chicago Children's Museum and the Shanti Foundation for Peace launched the Peace Bus on Martin Luther King Jr's birthday to promote healing and understanding. The idea came from Evanston artist and Shanti director Indira Johnson, who successfully applied the concept in 1993 to a train in her native India. About 120 fourth- and fifth-graders from Chicago schools began meeting in workshops for several months, eventually coming up with drawings and words that conveyed a sense of community. With Johnson's guidance, the older students painted the specially designated white bus at a CTA bus shop at 78th and Vincennes. The bus features colorful artwork and quotations from Martin Luther King Jr. , Mahatma Gandhi, Anne Frank and a Native American elder.

scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.

scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.

scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.

abstract: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection spans the years 1940-2000. The extensive collection is comprised of photographs and slides of primarily public bus and train transportation, chiefly in the Chicago, Illinois area.

scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.
series: Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection -- Slides, 1940-2000 -- Charter Coach/Shuttle, 1984-2000 -- Los Angeles and Barstow, CA, 1990-1997

scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.

abstract: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection spans the years 1940-2000. The extensive collection is comprised of photographs and slides of primarily public bus and train transportation, chiefly in the Chicago, Illinois area.
creator: Sullivan, Ronald J.
description: 3/4 view of car 2409 at the front of a 4-car CTA Green Line (East 63rd) train at the Randolph/Wabash station in Chicago, Illinois.  Randolph/Wabash was a elevated 'L' station in the Chicago Loop. Located at Randolph Street and Wabash Avenue, it served trains running on the CTA's Brown and Green Lines on the outer loop track, and the Green, Orange, Pink, and Purple Lines on the inner loop track. Randolph/Wabash was the closest 'L' station to Metra's Millennium Station until it closed on September 3, 2017. The station was later demolished. The train is servicing the East 63rd branch (Jackson Park branch) of the Green Line.

Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.
series: Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection -- Slides, 1940-2000 -- Rail, 1942-2000 --  "Ls", 1942-1997
subject: Chicago|Local transit stations|Chicago Transit Authority|Railroads, Elevated|Transportation|Local transit

Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.
series: Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection -- Slides, 1940-2000 -- Rail, 1942-2000 --  Freight rail, 1990-1998
subject: Chicago|Southern Pacific Railroad Company|Railroad trains|Railroads|Transportation|Locomotives

Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.
series: Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection -- Slides, 1940-2000 – Buses, 1940-2000
subject: Chicago|Chicago Transit Authority|Transportation|Local transit|Buses

The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.

scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.
series: Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection -- Slides, 1940-2000 -- Charter Coach/Shuttle, 1984-2000 -- Chicago, IL, 1984-1997
subject: Chicago|Transportation|Buses

scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.
series: Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection -- Photographs, 1946-2000 – Rail, 1948-1998
subject: Chicago|Chicago Transit Authority|Cable cars (Streetcars)|Local transit|Transportation

Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.
series: Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection -- Slides, 1940-2000 – Buses, 1940-2000
subject: Chicago|Transportation|Local transit|Cable cars (Streetcars)

scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.
series: Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection -- Photographs, 1946-2000 – Rail, 1948-1998
subject: Union|Railroads, Elevated|Transportation|Illinois Railway Museum|Chicago Transit Authority

Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.
series: Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection -- Slides, 1940-2000 – Buses, 1940-2000
subject: Chicago|Buses|Local transit|Transportation

The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.

scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.

This train was servicing the O'Hare-Douglas Branch of the Blue Line, also called the Cermak (Douglas) Branch. Blue Line service on the Douglas Branch was discontinued in April 2008 and replaced by the Pink Line.

The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.

Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.
series: Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection -- Photographs, 1946-2000 – Buses, 1946-2000
subject: Union|Buses|Transportation|Illinois Railway Museum

scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.
series: Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection -- Slides, 1940-2000 – Buses, 1940-2000
subject: Chicago|Transportation|Buses|Local transit
terms_of_use: The images on this web site, from material in the collections of the Transportation Library of Northwestern University Libraries, are provided for use by its students, faculty and staff, and by other researchers visiting this site, for research consultation and scholarly purposes only. scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.
series: Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection -- Slides, 1940-2000 -- Rail, 1942-2000 --  "Ls", 1942-1997
subject: Chicago|Chicago Transit Authority|Railroads, Elevated|Transportation|Local transit

description: 3/4 view of bus 605, route 38 (Indiana-63) at State Street and Madison Street in Chicago, Illinois. "Go the motor coach way" is written in the front of the bus under the windows.
project: {'cycle': '2018', 'desc': 'The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection spans the years 1940-2000. The collection is comprised of photographs and slides of primarily public bus and train transportation.', 'manager': 'Jen Young', 'name': 'Ronald J Sullivan Chicago Transportation Collection', 'proposer': 'Roberto Sarmiento', 'task_number': 'P0130'}
rights_statement: In Copyright - Rights-holder(s) Unlocatable or Unidentifiable
scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.
series: Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection -- Slides, 1940-2000 – Buses, 1940-2000
subject: Chicago|Chicago Motor Coach Company|Buses|Local transit|Transportation
terms_of_use: The images on this web site, from material in the collections of the Transportation Library of Northwestern University Libraries, are provided for use by its students, faculty and staff, and by other researchers visiting this site, for research consultation and scholarly purposes only. scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.
series: Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection -- Slides, 1940-2000 -- Charter Coach/Shuttle, 1984-2000 -- Los Angeles and Barstow, CA, 1990-1997
subject: Los Angeles|Hertz Corporation|Buses|Los Angeles International Airport|Transportation
terms_of_use: The images on this web site, from material in the collections of the Transportation Library of Northwestern University Libraries, are provided for use by its students, faculty and staff, and by other researchers visiting this site, for research consultation and scholarly purposes only. scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.
series: Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection -- Photographs, 1946-2000 – Buses, 1946-2000
subject: Chicago|Transportation|Buses

scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.
series: Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection -- Slides, 1940-2000 – Buses, 1940-2000
subject: Chicago|Chicago Transit Authority|Transportation|Buses|Local transit
terms_of_use: The images on this web site, from material in the collections of the Transportation Library of Northwestern University Libraries, are provided for use by its students, faculty and staff, and by other researchers visiting this site, for research consultation and scholarly purposes only. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.

description: 3/4 view of bus 7238, route 6, at 55th Street and Cicero Avenue in Chicago, Illinois. The bus is stopped in front of the Air Line Pilots Association, Int’l (ALPA) 27,000 square foot office building, adjacent to Midway Airport, at 5440 Cicero Avenue. The building was demolished, and its location today is now part of the realigned perimeter road of Midway’s northeast corner, near the rental car lots.

scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.

abstract: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection spans the years 1940-2000. The extensive collection is comprised of photographs and slides of primarily public bus and train transportation, chiefly in the Chicago, Illinois area.
creator: Sullivan, Ronald J.
description: 3/4 view of car 2451 at the front of a 4-car CTA Green Line (East 63rd) "L" train at the Randolph/Wabash station in Chicago, Illinois.  Randolph/Wabash was a elevated 'L' station in the Chicago Loop. Located at Randolph Street and Wabash Avenue, it served trains running on the CTA's Brown and Green Lines on the outer loop track, and the Green, Orange, Pink, and Purple Lines on the inner loop track. Randolph/Wabash was the closest 'L' station to Metra's Millennium Station until it closed on September 3, 2017. The station was later demolished. The train is servicing the East 63rd branch (Jackson Park branch) of the Green Line.

scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.

scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.
series: Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection -- Slides, 1940-2000 – Buses, 1940-2000
subject: Chicago|Buses|Local transit|Chicago Transit Authority|Transportation|Midway Airport

Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.
series: Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection -- Slides, 1940-2000 – Buses, 1940-2000
subject: Chicago|Chicago Transit Authority|Transportation|Buses|Local transit

scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.

scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.

scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.
series: Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection -- Slides, 1940-2000 – Ships, 1991-1993

scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.

description: 3/4 view of car 3162 at the front of a 8-car CTA Blue Line (O'Hare-Douglas) "L" train on the tracks in the middle of the Kennedy Expressway near Sayre Avenue in Chicago, Illinois. This train was servicing the O'Hare-Douglas Branch of the Blue Line, also called the Cermak (Douglas) Branch. Blue Line service on the Douglas Branch was discontinued in April 2008 and replaced by the Pink Line.

scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.

Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.
series: Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection -- Slides, 1940-2000 -- Rail, 1942-2000 --  Metra, 1990-1998
subject: Chicago|Metra (Ill.)|Transportation|Locomotives|Local transit
terms_of_use: The images on this web site, from material in the collections of the Transportation Library of Northwestern University Libraries, are provided for use by its students, faculty and staff, and by other researchers visiting this site, for research consultation and scholarly purposes only. description: 3/4 view of Pace bus 8749, route 270 (Jefferson Park) on Milwaukee Avenue and Carmen Avenue in Chicago, Illinois.
project: {'cycle': '2018', 'desc': 'The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection spans the years 1940-2000. The collection is comprised of photographs and slides of primarily public bus and train transportation.', 'manager': 'Jen Young', 'name': 'Ronald J Sullivan Chicago Transportation Collection', 'proposer': 'Roberto Sarmiento', 'task_number': 'P0130'}
rights_statement: In Copyright - Rights-holder(s) Unlocatable or Unidentifiable
scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.
series: Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection -- Slides, 1940-2000 -- Pace buses, 1986-1998
subject: Chicago|Illinois. Regional Transportation Authority. Suburban Bus Division|Transportation|Local transit|Buses
terms_of_use: The images on this web site, from material in the collections of the Transportation Library of Northwestern University Libraries, are provided for use by its students, faculty and staff, and by other researchers visiting this site, for research consultation and scholarly purposes only. scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.
series: Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection -- Slides, 1940-2000 -- Charter Coach/Shuttle, 1984-2000 -- Chicago, IL, 1984-1997
subject: Chicago|Transportation|Buses

Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.
series: Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection -- Slides, 1940-2000 -- Rail, 1942-2000 --  "Ls", 1942-1997
subject: Chicago|Chicago Transit Authority|Railroads, Elevated|Transportation|Local transit

abstract: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection spans the years 1940-2000. The extensive collection is comprised of photographs and slides of primarily public bus and train transportation, chiefly in the Chicago, Illinois area.
creator: Sullivan, Ronald J.
description: Side view of bus outside the State-Lake Theatre in Chicago, Illinois. The route 62 bus serviced the "Lake Front - State Street Shuttle Service" and is printed above the windows. "Parking Service Loop and Soldier Field" is written below the windows. "Chicago Motor Coach Company" is printed directly below the windows. The marquee for the theatre advertises the movie, "The Furies," with Barbara Stanwyck, Wendell Corey, and Walter Huston. The State-Lake Theatre closed June 28, 1984 and was later converted into studios and offices for the ABC network’s Chicago affiliate, WLS-TV.

scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.
series: Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection -- Slides, 1940-2000 – Buses, 1940-2000
subject: Chicago|Transportation|Local transit|Garages|Buses

description: 3/4 view of CTA bus 9131, route 60 (Blue Island/26-Cicero) at Michigan Avenue and Monroe Street in Chicago, Illinois.
project: {'cycle': '2018', 'desc': 'The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection spans the years 1940-2000. The collection is comprised of photographs and slides of primarily public bus and train transportation.', 'manager': 'Jen Young', 'name': 'Ronald J Sullivan Chicago Transportation Collection', 'proposer': 'Roberto Sarmiento', 'task_number': 'P0130'}
rights_statement: In Copyright - Rights-holder(s) Unlocatable or Unidentifiable
scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.
series: Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection -- Slides, 1940-2000 – Buses, 1940-2000
subject: Chicago|Buses|Local transit|Chicago Transit Authority|Transportation
terms_of_use: The images on this web site, from material in the collections of the Transportation Library of Northwestern University Libraries, are provided for use by its students, faculty and staff, and by other researchers visiting this site, for research consultation and scholarly purposes only. Further distribution and/or any commercial use of the images from this site is not permitted.

description: 3/4 view of Santa Fe locomotive 9506 at 49th Street and Kedzie Avenue in Chicago, Illinois.
notes: {'note': 'Note: Written on slide mount: "Santa Fe"', 'type': 'General Note'}
project: {'cycle': '2018', 'desc': 'The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection spans the years 1940-2000. The collection is comprised of photographs and slides of primarily public bus and train transportation.', 'manager': 'Jen Young', 'name': 'Ronald J Sullivan Chicago Transportation Collection', 'proposer': 'Roberto Sarmiento', 'task_number': 'P0130'}
rights_statement: In Copyright - Rights-holder(s) Unlocatable or Unidentifiable
scope_and_contents: The Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection is an extensive collection of photographs and slides of public and commercial buses and public transit and commuter trains, dating from 1946-2000. The bulk of the collection comprises photographs taken by Ronald J. Sullivan, an amateur photographer and rail and bus enthusiast; also included are historic images of Chicago-area transit that were part of Sullivan’s personal collection, and which supplement the photographer’s original material. The majority of the photographs were taken in Chicago, Illinois and the surrounding area, with a few in other cities and international locations. Sullivan documented nearly all of the photographs and slides in this collection in detail with bus or train numbers, route numbers, street intersections or stations, and dates.
series: Ronald J. Sullivan Photograph Collection -- Slides, 1940-2000 -- Rail, 1942-2000 --  Freight rail, 1990-1998
subject: Chicago|Railroad trains|Railroads|Atchison, Topeka, and Santa Fe Railroad Company|Transportation|Locomotives
terms_of_use: The images on this web site, from material in the collections of the Transportation Library of Northwestern University Libraries, are provided for use by its students, faculty and staff, and by other researchers visiting this site, for research consultation and scholarly purposes only. Further distribution and/or any commercial use of the images from this site is not permitted.
title: Santa Fe/9506, 49th & Kedzie
